titleStmt.title: Lord have mercy upon us, or the visitation at Oxford: Begun Aprill the 11. 1648.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Printed at Pembrook and Mongomery [i.e. London] :

notesStmt.note: "This piece, which pretends to be printed at Oxford, now turned into 'Pembroke and Montgomery' by the presence of her new Chancellor, satirically describes ... the four days which the earl of Pembroke (and Montgomery) spent in Oxford, April 11-14, 1648." (Madan).
"'Printed at Pembrook and Mongomery,' i.e. Oxford, but really at London." (Madan).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
